desc: AGO2, an enzyme involved in the RNA-mediated gene silencing, is overexpressed in various cancers.

The AGO2 gene encodes the argonaute 2 protein, which is involved in RNA-mediated gene silencing, or RNA interference (RNAi). Argonaute 2 forms part of the RNA-induced silencing complex (RISC) and has endonuclease activity (PMID: 15105377, 23746446). Argonaute 2 represents the catalytic element of the RISC complex, and upon single stranded RNA-mediated, complementarity-based recognition of mRNAs, either cleaves or inhibits translation of its targets (PMID: 19239886, 23654304). AGO2 is altered by amplification in various cancers, such as ovarian, breast and prostate (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Nov 2016).
